column4: Repeating: All,  Couple quick Qs.  1. Have DT and connect with wireless, but want to open eth0 to use router for local network. Anyone have resources for this?  2. Have bash script trying to work on remote web server, and giving error.  PB link paste.ubuntu.com/644262/
Which distribution is the remote server running?
Not sure, let me check

If it's Ubuntu, those aren't the right directories and filenames for Ubuntu servers. If it's running something RedHat-based (which is what uses those filenames), you'd need to ask in the channel for that distribution.

Yeah I'm thinking maybe some version of CentOS, but not sure.  Anyway is basic bash failure, cause is 'remature exit' error and not jumping out at me so not as good at debugging as I think I am.  LOL :)
premature not remature, Ha HA LOL
Think it is something inside the "IF Then"
I know remote host is not U-Box as I have to "su"+ pwd to log to superuser instead of sudo cmd.
If we change the Apache restart to run with /etc/init.d/apache2 restart, then all other code should run on U-Box, least I think, since simple move ('mv') and copy ('cp') commands.

Reason for this is permissions will not allow a direct upload on this machine, so have to load to local user folder, then jump to SU and execute the commands or script.  Right now the uploaded httpd.conf file has an error, so trying the scrip with 'restore' option to make this quick and not keep the server out of production with the errors occur.  Debugging the Apache errors is another effort, but have some other guys helping with that,
You try with changed call to Apache?
when your BIOS screen pops up after you press the power button, hold down shift. continue holding down shift. GRUB should pop up.
Think I already stated "that doesn't work", but if not here it is again.
I read what you said. You're doing it at the wrong time if it's not working :P
Anyway I want it to alway show, not have to worry about holding a key "at the right time" since that does not work at all on this box.  Tried it at least 20 times now and nothing.
I know there is a setting for how many seconds it will show.  Do you know the setting?
I forget, but if you're using GRUB 2, it's in https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2
Someone has this box set to "0" seconds show time, that is why does not show and pressing ESC or SHIFT not working.
On liveCD but just installed grub, and have it up.
Do you have a HOWTO for grub vs grub2?
I have our documentation on GRUB and on GRUB2. That's about it. GRUB2's, you have. GRUB's is https://help.ubuntu.com/community/GrubHowto
